comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Henry W. A. Page, a well-to-do merchant from NY, circulated a pamphlet in wich he claimed that „all congressman are crooks“. He was therefore arrested on charge of libelling. The Day book., April 23, 1912, Image 21 The times dispatch., April 10, 1912, Page 8 4th column

comment.author: 34985608@N03
comment._content: B-59: Thanks for providing a fuller name for this person, which we'll add to the record when we update.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: It seems that it's is the same guy as this: Therefore, my identification above was obviously wrong (in spite of the similarity of the photo) and it's in fact William H. Page, an attorney and a former president of the New York Athletic Club (see notes under the picture).
